* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* does not appear in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). |                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                                       |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3873](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.3/src/monst.c#L3873)               |

A **frost salamander**, :, is a type of monster that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The frost salamander is a [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") [reptilian](/wiki/Lizard_\(monster_class\) "Lizard (monster class)") monster that is a [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") counterpart to the [salamander](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander"): they only reside in icy areas, and can freeze [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water underneath them. Similar to their fiery brethren, frost salamanders can wear all [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") except [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") and wield [weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon").

A frost salamander has a weapon attack, a cold touch attack, and two bearhugs that inflict cold damage. Frost salamanders possess [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") and [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), and are [vulnerable](/wiki/Vulnerable "Vulnerable") to [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire").

A frost salamander is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to [eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat"), but eating a frost salamander [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") confers high percentage of [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), though the corpse is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous").

## Generation

Frost salamanders are always created hostile. In EvilHack, they are only randomly generated in the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm"), and in Hack'EM they are generated normally.

Four frost salamanders patrol the icy river on the uppermost floor of the Ice Queen's Realm at level creation, and four more are generated on the middle floor containing the [Abominable Snowman](/wiki/Abominable_Snowman_\(EvilHack\) "Abominable Snowman (EvilHack)") at level creation. [Kathryn the Ice Queen](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Ice_Queen "Kathryn the Ice Queen") can generate hostile frost salamanders with the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

Frost salamanders are [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") either a [halberd](/wiki/Halberd "Halberd") (3⁄4 chance) or a spetum (1⁄4 chance).

Frost salamanders cannot be targeted for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").

## Strategy

While frost salamanders are incapable of [drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning") a character in pools like salamanders can in [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"), their strong attacks and cold damage can prove perilous for the unprepared. Most fire sources such as a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") or the [fireball](/wiki/Fireball "Fireball") spell are viable methods to fight off frost salamanders, and characters that entered the Ice Queen's Realm without full intrinsic cold resistance can top themselves off with frost salamander corpses and tins.

## Encyclopedia entry

For hundreds of years, many people believed that salamanders were magical. In England in the Middle Ages, people thought that fire created salamanders. When they set fire to damp logs, dozens of the slimy creatures scurried out. The word salamander, in fact, comes from a Greek word meaning "fire animal".

\[ Salamanders, by Cherie Winner ]
html:
Frost salamander

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
: frost salamander (No tile)
Difficulty 13
Attacks Weapon 2d8, Touch 1d8 cold, Hug 3d6 cold, Hug 2d6 cold
: frost salamander (No tile)
Difficulty 13
Attacks

Weapon 2d8, Touch 1d8 cold, Hug 3d6 cold, Hug 2d6 cold

Base level 10
Base experience 245
Speed 12
Base AC -3
Base MR 0
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 1500
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances sleep, cold
Resistances conveyed cold (66%)

A frost salamander:

  • can swim.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • has a serpent body.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • has infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 3873

A frost salamander, :, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. The frost salamander is a humanoid reptilian monster that is a cold counterpart to the salamander: they only reside in icy areas, and can freeze pools of water underneath them. Similar to their fiery brethren, frost salamanders can wear all armor except boots and wield weapons.

A frost salamander has a weapon attack, a cold touch attack, and two bearhugs that inflict cold damage. Frost salamanders possess cold resistance and sleep resistance, and are vulnerable to fire.

A frost salamander is poisonous to eat, but eating a frost salamander corpse or tin confers high percentage of cold resistance, though the corpse is poisonous.

Generation

Frost salamanders are always created hostile. In EvilHack, they are only randomly generated in the Ice Queen's Realm, and in Hack'EM they are generated normally.

Four frost salamanders patrol the icy river on the uppermost floor of the Ice Queen's Realm at level creation, and four more are generated on the middle floor containing the Abominable Snowman at level creation. Kathryn the Ice Queen can generate hostile frost salamanders with the summon nasties monster spell.

Frost salamanders are generated with either a halberd (3⁄4 chance) or a spetum (1⁄4 chance).

Frost salamanders cannot be targeted for genocide.

Strategy

While frost salamanders are incapable of drowning a character in pools like salamanders can in lava, their strong attacks and cold damage can prove perilous for the unprepared. Most fire sources such as a wand of fire or the fireball spell are viable methods to fight off frost salamanders, and characters that entered the Ice Queen's Realm without full intrinsic cold resistance can top themselves off with frost salamander corpses and tins.

Encyclopedia entry

For hundreds of years, many people believed that salamanders were magical. In England in the Middle Ages, people thought that fire created salamanders. When they set fire to damp logs, dozens of the slimy creatures scurried out. The word salamander, in fact, comes from a Greek word meaning "fire animal".

[ Salamanders, by Cherie Winner ]

A '''frost salamander''', {{brightblue|:}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. The frost salamander is a [[humanoid]] [[Lizard (monster class)|reptilian]] monster that is a [[cold]] counterpart to the [[salamander]]: they only reside in icy areas, and can freeze [[pool]]s of water underneath them. Similar to their fiery brethren, frost salamanders can wear all [[armor]] except [[boots]] and wield [[weapon]]s.

A frost salamander has a weapon attack, a cold touch attack, and two bearhugs that inflict cold damage. Frost salamanders possess [[cold resistance]] and [[sleep resistance]], and are [[vulnerable]] to [[fire]].

A frost salamander is [[poisonous]] to [[eat]], but eating a frost salamander [[corpse]] or [[tin]] confers high percentage of [[cold resistance]], though the corpse is [[poisonous]].

==Generation==
Frost salamanders are always created hostile. In EvilHack, they are only randomly generated in the [[Ice Queen's Realm]], and in Hack'EM they are generated normally.

Four frost salamanders patrol the icy river on the uppermost floor of the Ice Queen's Realm at level creation, and four more are generated on the middle floor containing the [[Abominable Snowman (EvilHack)|Abominable Snowman]] at level creation. [[Kathryn the Ice Queen]] can generate hostile frost salamanders with the [[summon nasties]] [[monster spell]].

Frost salamanders are [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] either a [[halberd]] ({{frac|3|4}} chance) or a spetum ({{frac|4}} chance).

Frost salamanders cannot be targeted for [[genocide]].

==Strategy==
While frost salamanders are incapable of [[drowning]] a character in pools like salamanders can in [[lava]], their strong attacks and cold damage can prove perilous for the unprepared. Most fire sources such as a [[wand of fire]] or the [[fireball]] spell are viable methods to fight off frost salamanders, and characters that entered the Ice Queen's Realm without full intrinsic cold resistance can top themselves off with frost salamander corpses and tins.

When they set fire to damp logs, dozens of the slimy creatures scurried out.  The word salamander, in fact, comes from a Greek word meaning "fire animal".
